Presenting Complaints (Symptoms):
1. Autonomic overactivity (sweating, tachycardia)
2. Motor tension (inability to relax)
History: Present history: Patient has been an average student in studies. He wishes to perform better and has been consistently facing issues whenever he sits to solve the quiz/ test on his own. This consists of MCQs. It makes his hands sweaty, heart pounding and an inability to relax.  This only happens when he has to solve the quiz.
Current Mental Status Examination: General behavior: Rapport was established and patient was cooperative; Mood: Anxious; Affect: Restricted; Thought: Content- Reflected worry about performing well in tests.
Psychotherapy Type: Type: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy; Mode: Individual
Issues discussed in Current Session: It was discussed that how patient's core beliefs (for ex, "I'm a failure) lead to the intermediate beliefs which combine with situational factors lead to automatic thoughts.
Reflections by the therapist: Patient's negative automatic thought were focused upon. He had been facing cognitive distortion of overgeneralisation and personalisation. Some ways of handling it with respect to adaptive response were focussed upon.
Action Plan: Practice positive self talk, maintain a diary showing evidence for the beliefs
